reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a dream come true. When we were totally overwhelmed with the hustle, crowds, and traffic of the city, we found a refuge in the quiet, rejuvenating recluse provided by the hotel's grounds and pool. The service was excellent, and the prices for food and drinks (even poolside) were extremely reasonable.
reviews.title: An oasis in the chaos of Kathmandu
Loved the stay
reviews.text: The walk to Boudhanath Stupa was charming as it lead us through the local neighborhood rather than down the main street, and it was a pleasant way to start the day.

The only "downside" about this hotel is that it's not very close to Dubar Square, Thamel, or Swayambhunath, but when your exploring is through for the day, I can't think of a better place to relax than at this "out of the way" hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced middle class

reviews.text: Nice hotel with lovely green surroundings. food is good and rooms are very comfortable
reviews.title: Hard to top this hotel
Top class hotel
reviews.text: When you see pictures of this hotel and also when you arrive, walk in and see the beatiful stupa in front of you you think: it's worth it! Wait until you see your room.
The Hyatt is in central Kathmandu with large gardens surrounding it and enclosed by a wall. The entrance lobby is impressive and makes an excellent impression.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
it was kool
reviews.text: There is a very large swimming pool in the gardens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants are very good indeed.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and courteous and there is a good business centre.
reviews.title: Superb in every way
An outstandin Experience
reviews.text: It is possible and safe to walk out of the hotel into the surrounding streets and there is a major buddhist temple within a few minutes walk.

reviews.title: Great hotel with good location, nice rooms
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in early November after deciding to move from the Gokarna Forest Resort (after it stopped being a Le Meridien).

reviews.title: Oasis in the midst of one of the worst traffic jungles
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and located relatively close to the airport and downtown. It has two (good) restaurants and a casino next door. There is a nice view of the stuppa from the hotel and the rooms are good quality as well. It was mainly tour groups and post/pre-trekkers when we were there, and got busy at times.

The staff was decent, but not overly friendly or helpful, but they got the job done. It's definitely the nicest hotel in Kathmandu and if you want a standard Western hotel then I'd definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Cuisine
Excellent experience
reviews.text: Now I understand why I was warned that I would face one of the world's worst traffic nightmares in Nepal before I went. I don't believe there was a single traffic light or stop sign in the whole country! So drivers have to fight their ways through the maddening traffic, constantly using their horns to let others know that they are there.

At the end of the day, one wonders how much hearing loss had been sustained. So it is a much welcomed relief to find the Grand Hyatt, in the midst of all this, has a large, beautiful, well shielded-off compound that one could not hear any of these or sniff any of the exhaust fumes that filled the air outside the compound wall! The hotel is well appointed, and the staff are all warm, friendly and well trained.
reviews.title: If you can - stay here

likes.disliked: — pigeons outside the room caused minor disruption.

reviews.text: What a shame. This hotel in a good location and beautifully appointed rooms was beset by work stoppages by hotel employees demanding a 100% salary and 40% dearness allowance (whatever that is) raise. Three days in a row this happened. It got so disruptive that our group was glad to be out of the place each day before the strike started at 09.00 hrs.
reviews.title: Strikes Absolutely Ruined the Stay

reviews.text: This is a mess that just made the stay quite unbearable. We saw a guest cooking his own eggs because the staff walked out of the coffee shop in the middle of breakfast!
reviews.title: wanna go again n again

reviews.text: No matter how good the hotel is with its facilities and food, just avoid this sorry excuse for a five-star property.
reviews.title: Extremely Good

likes.liked: — The architecture, cultural and traditional touch to everything, huge open area and beautiful gardens
likes.disliked: — There is no mkt. at walkable distance so u will have a hire cab to the nearest place.

reviews.text: When you see pictures of this hotel and also when you arrive, walk in and see the beatiful stupa in front of you you think: it's worth it!The Hyatt is a newer and more modern hotel, The hotel is nice and clean and the staff is very friendly, The spa, fitness centre, tennis court, Swimmng pool and the Restaurants are fantastic. Staff very friendly. Great deal! In the afternoons live folk music dance all were fantastic,i wish i would go again
reviews.title: Great hotel
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: There must be many good hotels which i would like to explore and experience, but if I have to choose one hotel out of all those I have ever stayed in....I think Hyatt Regency Kathmandu, Nepal was the best.
Kathmandu, Nepal - Hyatt Regency Hotel
reviews.title: Great Service at the Hyatt Kathmandu

reviews.text: Date: Oct. 28th 2008
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel in an ugly City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am in Kathmandu for a 22 day visit with the local churches. During my time i have been at the Hyatt Regency and have been greeted graciously and made to feel welcomed by all of the staff here.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Kathmandu...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In particular Mr. Admaram Simkhada has given me his exceptional warm welcomes everytime I have been dropped off via the taxi. All of the staff has gone out of their way to make my stay comfortable here. Each day I am glade to see the people who tiddy up the room because I again get to meet Mishra Balkrishna who is so happy to be doing his job and full of warm conversation and gretings if I am in the room. These two individuals have impressed me with their dedication to their job and friendliness.
reviews.title: Peace and tranquilty

reviews.text: The rest of the staff has helpped to make the stay a great one.
reviews.title: A Very Relaxing Oasis

likes.disliked: — i had a nice stay so nothing really

reviews.text: With one fairly major exception (which I'll get to later) I enjoyed my stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice, except for the pigeons!

reviews.text: At first I was concerned that the Hyatt might be too far "out of town." Although it is about a 30 minute ride into central Kathmandu, that's not likely to be the only place you'll be visiting, so the location is really not inconvenient. The TIbetan Buddhist community of Boudha is just a few minutes walk from the hotel, and was one of the most fascinating places I saw in the 5 days I was in the Kathmandu area.
reviews.title: Huge Thumbs Up for Hyatt in Kathmandu

likes.disliked: — There was nothing not to like....

reviews.text: After seeing the Thamel area, I would not want to stay there. In fact, I wouldn't particularly want to go back there at all.
reviews.title: Really excellent hotel

likes.liked: — The building and the sunday jazz brunch in the gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was a stupa view, on the Gold Passport (fifth) floor. The room itself was adequate - the wood floor was quite scruffy and could use a good washing or even refinishing. The bathroom was excellent: large, new and spacious. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: The food at the hotel cafe is reasonably priced (for a Hyatt) and very, very good.
reviews.title: Superb comfort, but a bit too big
Hyatt Kathmandu
reviews.text: Nice hotel, walking distance to the Buddhist Stupa (follow the path from the pool out of the complex through the residential area)

I was there on official business but my family paid me a visit during the Christmas holiday for 10 days. I wanted to put my family there as it was simply a beautiful and magnificent hotel located close to the airport and away from the bustling city. It is also a short walking distance to the stupa through the side entry/exit. I must say that we had a wonderful stay there for 6 days. And the food at the restaurants as well as the service were excellent. The 4pm snack time on the top floor was even more special and a nice touch as it gave us time to relax after a long days visit to town and shopping before dinner. EFA
reviews.title: Great relaxing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I went to the Hyatt, Kathmandu for my 40th birthday and romantic getaway. The room was beautifully set up and very comfortable. The highlight was the spa massage session, having been spoilt by spas in Indonesia - I was not expecting any rivals, but the spa treatment was very good. The meal was ok, could have been better - but the atmosphere made up for that.
reviews.title: Hyatt Kathmandu - Ideal Getaway

reviews.text: This is one of the best hotels if not the best hotel in Kathmandu. It is truly beautiful inside and outside and has wonderful staff that understand how to look after their guests. The view from my hotel window was breathtaking with the Himalayas looking at me.
reviews.title: A beautiful, picturesque and relaxing escape in a busy city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No matter how hard I try to find anything wrong with this hotel, I cannot. Everything was perfect - the rooms, the service, the food, the staff, the price and the views.
reviews.title: Truly an oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the end of Sep. The hotel was located outside of city central, but I did not mind the distance. The hotel was big, but it was not crowded and I could relax. The room had woody feeling and great view of Stupa from the room. We were there during Napali holiday and many places were unfortunately closed. So we went to Stupa everyday, early morning and late night. We really enjoyed it. We also ate at the hotel which was good. And it looks like many expatriates also come for restaurant. The swimming pool was big and nice. The next time, I would like to stay longer.
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday

reviews.text: Positives: The hotel's common areas are just gorgeous, and the rooms are pretty enough. The staff is very eager to help.
reviews.title: Beautiful but noisy and uncomfortable

reviews.text: But.... the hotel doesn't get the concept of what a non smoking room is. I stayed in this hotel for 10 days, and the mattress was so uncomfortable that I had bruises on my hips from the protruding metal springs. I got very sick one night after eating a sandwich from room service. The hotel called a doctor right away, but it made me wonder about hygiene in the kitchen.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel away from hustle bustle of the city

reviews.text: The hotel is one of the noisiest ones I've ever been too. The noise from the cleaning staff, banging doors, water pipes, screaming babies, loud TVs, etc is just relentless whether day or night. Sound insulation between the rooms and between the hallway and rooms is non-existent.
reviews.title: Nice place; superb grounds

reviews.text: Overall it's not up to Hyatt standards.
reviews.title: Oasis
